intro: Scabiosa wulfeniana, commonly known as the Woolly Scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fluffy, spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Scabiosa wulfeniana is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
